Learning to make websites

Always knew the basics of HTML since I was a kid, but decided to start learning this properly at the end of 2021.

What I found out so far:

  • Writing CSS sucks, I settled on using BootStrap:
    1. Well documented
    2. Extremely popular, which means it is easy to find help and is well tested.
  • Writing more than one HTML page without a Template system seems nuts. I settled on learning Hugo

I know next to nothing about building websites, but it seems that creating/serving a static website with a template system and hosting 'Apps' somewhere else for dynamic content is a simple way of doing things. Let's try.
